title: Classic Sports Cars Championship Welcomes Historic Marques
author: Heritage Racing
excerpt: The Classic Sports Cars championship expands its historic marque representation with new entries from Jaguar, Aston Martin, and Ferrari joining the prestigious field.
body: The Classic Sports Cars championship continues to grow its representation of historic marques with exciting new entries from Jaguar, Aston Martin, and Ferrari joining the already prestigious field of vintage racing machinery. These additions represent some of the most iconic names in motorsport history.

The new entries include a beautifully restored Jaguar E-Type, an Aston Martin DB4 GT, and a Ferrari 250 GT SWB, each representing the pinnacle of their respective eras. These cars will compete alongside existing entries from Porsche, Lotus, and other legendary manufacturers.

"Having such iconic marques represented in our championship is a testament to the quality and authenticity of our series," said Championship Director Robert Sterling. "These cars represent the golden age of sports car racing and deserve to be seen and heard on track."

Each new entry has undergone extensive authentication and preparation to ensure historical accuracy while meeting modern safety standards. The process involves detailed research into original specifications and racing history.

The expanded field will make its debut at the Phillip Island Classic, where the combination of historic cars and the iconic circuit is expected to create a truly spectacular weekend of vintage motorsport action.
